name: Introduction to International Relations
description: A survey course of the field of International Relations, covering the major theories, actors, conflicts, and institutions of global politics.

name: International Security
description: A study of the sources of security and insecurity in the international system, including the causes and consequences of war, the rise of terrorism, and the dynamics of arms control.

name: International Political Economy
description: An examination of the interaction between politics and economics in the international system, including the roles of states, international institutions, and multinational corporations.

name: Comparative Politics
description: An introduction to the study of political systems around the world, covering topics such as political culture, regime types, democratization, and globalization.

name: International Law
description: A survey of the major legal instruments and institutions governing international relations, from the UN Charter to the International Court of Justice.

name: International Organizations
description: An exploration of the role of international organizations in global governance, focusing on the structure and functioning of the UN and other major international institutions.

name: International Negotiation and Conflict Resolution
description: An introduction to the theory and practice of international negotiation and conflict resolution, covering topics such as game theory, bargaining, and mediation.
